qas.question: What was the average unemployment rate in the U.S. in 2014?
How many jobs were gained in 2014?
What industries accounted for most of the city's job gains?

answers.text: education and health services, leisure and hospitality, and professional and business services

context: Philadelphia's an annualized unemployment rate was <a0_0>7.8%<a0_0/> in 2014, down from 10.0%the previous year. This is higher than the national average of <a1_0>6.2%<a1_0/>. Similarly, the rate of new jobs added to the city's economy lagged behind the national job growth. In 2014, about <a2_0>8,800<a2_0/> jobs were added to the city's economy. Sectors with the largest number of jobs added were in <a3_0>education and health services, leisure and hospitality, and professional and business services<a3_0/>. Declines were seen in the city's <a4_0>manufacturing and government<a4_0/> sectors.
